name: gitted
description: create a website that takes in input the ouath of claude, makes you connect your github and lets you select which repositories you want to include. once all this happens the website create you the "story" of all the projects (for each of them, and all of them together), you must be smart as there may be thousands of commits. it also creates the "wrapped" just like the spotify wrapped logics or like  (look at that codebase). and it also creates the gource of the different repositories and of all of them together. you can look at /Users/arditbiniqi/WebstormProjects/gource/improoooovoedGource.py as an example. so in short it's a website of multiple repositories that smartly gives you the backstory, user analytics and performances by month/year. etc. be smart about it.

pages.name: Landing
pages.description: Hero landing page introducing the Git Story & Wrapped experience. Features an animated hero section with a 'Get Started' CTA, preview animations of wrapped cards and gource visualizations, feature highlights (Story, Wrapped, Gource, Analytics), and social proof/stats. Dark themed with vibrant gradients inspired by Spotify Wrapped aesthetics.

pages.name: Connect
pages.description: Authentication and setup page. User enters their Claude OAuth token, connects their GitHub account via OAuth, and sees a searchable/filterable list of all their repositories (with org repos). They can select/deselect repos to include, see repo metadata (stars, commits, language), and proceed to generate their wrapped. Handles pagination for users with hundreds of repos.

pages.name: Dashboard
pages.description: Main analytics dashboard showing an overview of all selected repositories combined. Displays total commits, lines added/removed, active days, top languages, contribution heatmap calendar, commit frequency charts by month/year, peak coding hours, and quick navigation cards to Story, Wrapped, and Gource sections. Smart aggregation handles thousands of commits efficiently.

pages.name: Story
pages.description: AI-generated narrative backstory page powered by Claude. For each selected repository and all combined, Claude analyzes commit messages, code changes, and timelines to generate a compelling developer journey narrative. Presented as a scrollable timeline with chapters, milestones, pivots, and breakthroughs. Includes per-repo stories and a unified 'Developer Journey' story. Uses smart batching/summarization for repos with thousands of commits.

pages.name: Wrapped
pages.description: Spotify Wrapped-style interactive slideshow experience. Full-screen animated cards revealing stats one by one: top repos, most productive month, longest streak, most used language, biggest single-day push, collaboration stats, fun superlatives, year-over-year growth. Each slide has bold typography, vibrant gradients, smooth transitions, and shareable card generation. Covers monthly and yearly breakdowns.

pages.name: Gource
pages.description: Interactive Gource-style visualization page rendering an animated tree/graph of repository file evolution over time. Users can view individual repo visualizations or a combined multi-repo view. Built as a WebGL/Canvas animation showing files as nodes, directories as branches, with contributors appearing as avatars making changes. Playback controls (play, pause, speed, scrub), camera controls, and filtering by date range or contributor. Inspired by the Python gource script reference.

pages.name: Repository Detail
pages.description: Deep-dive page for a single selected repository. Shows detailed analytics: commit history graph, contributor breakdown, file change treemap, branch activity, PR/issue stats, code frequency by week, top contributors, and an AI-generated summary of the repo's evolution. Links to that repo's individual Story, Wrapped slide, and Gource visualization.

Here's how you can help: Open an Issue Found a bug? Have a feature request? Open an issue describing what you'd like to change. Submit a Pull Request Fork the repository Create a new branch for your feature Make your changes Submit a PR with: Clear description of the changes Link to the related issue Sample result/screenshot if applicable Wait for review üìù License The code in this repository is licensed under the MIT License.
